body_html:
@GaofengCheng What is your environment setup? Would it be possible to create a clean virtual environment and test it there? Also, can you provide the pip list and content of pip.log

I think this is a related by different issue -- because even after install, your pip is using a different version, my suspicion is that your python and pip are located in different locations. If you try using virtualenv, it might fix that.
body_text:
@GaofengCheng What is your environment setup? Would it be possible to create a clean virtual environment and test it there? Also, can you provide the pip list and content of pip.log
I think this is a related by different issue -- because even after install, your pip is using a different version, my suspicion is that your python and pip are located in different locations. If you try using virtualenv, it might fix that.
body:
@GaofengCheng What is your environment setup? Would it be possible to create a clean virtual environment and test it there? Also, can you provide the `pip list` and content of `pip.log`

I think this is a related by different issue -- because even after install, your pip is using a different version, my suspicion is that your `python` and `pip` are located in different locations. If you try using `virtualenv`, it might fix that.
